duties_responsibilities.duty: Direct efforts within the Product Performance Engineering Section and between other TS Tech groups, customers, and suppliers during the entire product lifecycle.
Ensure that products meet or exceed customer and/or internal requirements by identifying and solving problems that arise with products and processes.
Mentor other engineers within the section.
Communicate and collaborate between different groups to achieve overall company goals.
Manage customer and supplier relationships, expectations, negotiations, and communication.
Create and maintain schedules to proactively manage areas of responsibility and resources across multiple projects.
Understand and locate applicable information, analyze, solve, and communicate problems and solutions, and demonstrate overall engineering aptitude.
Support department goals for internal benchmarking, development proposals, and innovation.
Propose VAVE ideas to meet targets without compromising specifications and transfer technical knowledge to department associates.
Prepare and present technical reports and presentations, and actively participate in sectional, departmental, project, and customer meetings.
Develop and propose reoccurrence prevention methods and seek out, understand, and communicate new or revised regulations and requirements.
Actively develop new tools, standards, and procedures.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or equivalent technical/work experience. Proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook. MS Project knowledge is a plus.
